item.title: The Clever D Block Initiative
item.description:
During the recent 700 MHz spectrum auction, a small frequency band known as D Block went unsold because it didn’t reach its reserve price. This is unfortunate because D Block was supposed to play a crucial role in establishing a nationwide public service network. This plan, which could serve as a model for other initiatives, deserves further consideration, especially in challenging economic times. The idea for D Block originated after the September 11, 2001, attacks, when communication breakdowns hampered rescue efforts...

item.title: Looking For Spectrum In All The White Spaces
item.description:
With the recent 700 MHz spectrum auction concluded, the wireless industry is feeling a sense of scarcity. All the valuable over-the-air spectrum, much like desirable beachfront property, has seemingly been claimed. However, instead of viewing the spectrum as fully allocated, consider it as a landscape inhabited by powerful entities, like T-Rexes in the Cretaceous period. These dominant players, representing major TV stations, control their portions of the spectrum, leaving little room for newcomers...
